image.altText: A flag with the colours of the rainbow flying on a flag post.

props.synopsis: A controversial anti-hate speech measure introduced by the Northern Territory's previous Labor government is being scrapped by the Country Liberal Party, just three years after being introduced.

title.children: ‘It’s about rights’: Religious leader welcomes discrimination law rollback

image.altText: A large sign reading 'Arnhem Space Centre', on a patch of red dirt.

props.synopsis: The Northern Land Council has doubled down on its criticism of Australian space company Equatorial Launch Australia, claiming it displayed "less than satisfactory conduct" prior to the closure of its East Arnhem Land space centre.

title.children: Northern Land Council doubles down on criticism of Equatorial Launch Australia

image.altText: A police car in the foreground, with red tape across the front of a house's yard and a police officer standing on a ladder

props.synopsis: A 33-year-old man has been killed in an alleged domestic violence incident in Darwin. A woman, believed to be the man's partner, has been arrested at the scene.

title.children: Darwin man killed in alleged domestic violence incident

image.altText: A kelpie collie dog, with brown fur in two shades and white patches sitting on couch next to blurred owner in background.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of Australian households have a pet, but in some states body corporates can ban even home owners from keeping animals. With high-density housing on the rise, strata industry leaders and pet owners are advocating for change.

title.children: In four Australian jurisdictions, body corporates are allowed to ban pets

image.altText: A woman and man sit on horses, next to other horses carrying packs in front of a sign for Tolhuin in Aregentina.

props.synopsis: Australian Ben Hann and Canadian Olivia Cazes will spend the better part of a decade taking horses through the 14 countries along the 30,000-kilometre Pan American Highway.

title.children: Horse riders launch seven-year journey from Argentina to Alaska

image.altText: a woman uses a pencil to draw on a colourful map

props.synopsis: Newly released videos show evidence involving "confection" used by the Environmental Defenders Office in its failed legal bid to halt Santos's Barossa gas pipeline west of the Tiwi Islands.

title.children: Videos show EDO evidence slammed by judge in failed Santos challenge

image.altText: Woman holding a baby next to a man

props.synopsis: A researcher hopes to unlock the mystery of why Indigenous babies are disproportionately affected by their mother's exposure to tobacco smoke.

title.children: 'Trailblazing' smoking study aims to close the gap for First Nations kids

image.altText: The exterior of the Northern Territory's Parliament House building.

props.synopsis: Changes to the NT's controversial territory coordinator bill that would modify heritage laws and create new powers to enter private property, in a bid to fast-track economic development, have come under fresh scrutiny.

title.children: 'Now less protective': Territory coordinator bill under fresh scrutiny

image.altText: The Northern Territory Supreme Court in Darwin.

props.synopsis: A mentally ill man indefinitely detained in a Darwin prison is "treading water, if not going backwards", with a government staffer now due to testify about his care after a judge labelled it "completely, obviously, unacceptable".

title.children: Mentally ill prisoner indefinitely detained after secure centre closes

image.altText: A primary school-aged boy standing inside a room of a house and smiling.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man in South Australia after a 12-year-old Alice Springs boy, missing since Thursday, was found safe and well in Coober Pedy.

title.children: Missing 12-year-old Alice Springs boy found in Coober Pedy, man arrested

image.altText: A woman in a pink dress stands with a man. The man has his arm around her

props.synopsis: The third anniversary of Chris "Willow" Wilson's death in a helicopter crash has been marked with stirring words by his widow, Danielle Wilson. It comes as Mr Wilson's co-star Matt Wright is due to face trial later this year on one count of perverting the course of justice.

title.children: 'Spirit lives on': Netflix star's widow shares tribute ahead of trial

image.altText: A composite image of three men in suits

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump up-ends world order during his first few weeks in power, Xi Jinping is quietly testing the boundaries of this new reality, and the fallout could be felt in Ukraine, Taiwan and Australia.

title.children: As Trump radically shifts the global order, Xi tests new boundaries

image.altText: A woman sits at a desk and looks into the camera. Her reflection can be seen on a computer screen.

props.synopsis: The ABC looked at how home insurance premiums compared for different age groups around the country — the results were surprising.

title.children: $17,000 dropped from home insurance premium when owner queried the cost

image.altText: Our AI future

props.synopsis: The future rarely unfolds like we expect. Although Hollywood has given us plenty of technological tropes to worry about, our AI future is much more mundane and much more insidious.

title.children: Our AI future isn't conscious robots with lethal ambition. It might be worse

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a black suit and a pastel green tie, speaks in front of a Medicare backdrop

props.synopsis: The prime minister's Overton window is the size of a porthole but the paradox of Albanese's policy conservatism is that he's left Peter Dutton with very little to unwind should the Coalition win.

title.children: Albanese's hesitancy won't help his chances of a long-term Labor legacy

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy boarding a Ukrainian government plane on stairs.

props.synopsis: As the embattled Ukrainian leader prepares to meet with European leaders in London, tough questions will need to be asked about what steps the continent can take.

title.children: After Trump and Zelenskyy's heated clash, what now for Ukraine?

image.altText: A military helicopter lands in bushland, kicking up clouds of dust.

props.synopsis: An experienced army pilot has told an inquiry into the Taipan helicopter crash, which claimed the lives of four airmen, he would have considered not completing the mission had it been in similar conditions.

title.children: Fatal army mission 'failed as soon as they took off', Taipan inquiry hears

image.altText: Vicky Whitfield lies on her back with medical staff around her and the Australia team looking on

props.synopsis: The Jillaroos take on England's Lionesses in NRL Las Vegas before the Panthers take on the Sharks. Earlier, the Canberra Raiders thumped the Warriors. Follow live.

title.children: Horror head clash halts play in second half as Jillaroos bring up 50

image.altText: A large wave crashing on rocks.

props.synopsis: Authorities are preparing for heavy rainfall and gale force winds as Tropical Cyclone Alfred is forecast to cross south-east Queensland and northern New South Wales on Thursday.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Alfred forecast to make landfall from Thursday

image.altText: Dark military aircrafts viewed head-on on a runway

props.synopsis: The federal opposition says it will reverse Labor's scrapping of extra F-35 fighter jets, pledging to increase Australia's fleet to 100 if it wins the looming election.

title.children: Coalition pledges $3 billion to acquire extra joint strike fighter jets

image.altText: A man holds a greeny blue freshwater crayfish in front of his face, with water and plants in the background.

props.synopsis: Australian redclaw have sent wildlife authorities into damage control after the crayfish were found in the wild in the US state of Texas.

title.children: Australian redclaw crayfish go feral in US waterways

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man crouching down on a riverbank inspecting a bit of rock

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder says it is disgraceful an ancient cultural site on the Murray River was damaged during the summer holiday period.

title.children: Elder blasts 'disgraceful' damage to riverside midden site

image.altText: Headshot of smiling R'n'B singer Angie Stone

props.synopsis: American singer Angie Stone, who was nominated for three Grammy Awards, dies in a car crash aged 63.

title.children: Grammy-nominated R'n'B singer Angie Stone dies in car crash

image.altText: The outside of a historical pub named THE PYRMONT BRIDGE HOTEL  on a clear sunny day

props.synopsis: Vishal Gurung faced court in January after being charged with assaulting and sexually touching a woman, but failed to attend his next court date days later.

title.children: Man on the run after alleged assault of woman at Sydney bar

image.altText: A lady, Emma Young, smiling at the camera for a photo

props.synopsis: Data shows a one-person household can spend $2,835 per month on living costs compared to couples who spend a combined $4,118 per month, or $2,059 per person.

title.children: The singles tax shows the 'cold hard costs' of flying solo

image.altText: Millwall goalkeeper Liam Roberts karate kicks Jean-Philippe Mateta of Crystal Palace in the head

props.synopsis: Crystal Palace forward Jean-Philippe Mateta was taken to hospital with a head injury after a rash challenge by Millwall goalkeeper Liam Roberts.

title.children: Goalkeeper sent off, player in hospital after karate kick to the head

image.altText: A young Clea Duvall and Natasha Lyonne wear head to toe pink in the woods in But I'm a Cheerleader.

props.synopsis: But I'm a Cheerleader, the campy, silly antidote to the Bury Your Gays trope, was ahead of its time. We explore the legacy of this 25-year-old cult classic.

title.children: Initially panned, this 25-year-old film became a 'beloved' cult classic

image.altText: Three men standing on the podium of a skiing event, the Canadian flag shown behind

props.synopsis: Australia's Matt Graham was part of a first for World Cup mogul skiing, with his bronze medal in the dual event in Kazakhstan part of a "dad podium".

title.children: Aussie moguls ace bags another World Cup bronze on 'dad podium'

image.altText: A human skull resting on a large fabric cloth.

props.synopsis: In the 1800s, a Russian explorer took 16 human skulls from Papua New Guinea to prove a theory. Now they've finally been returned home.

title.children: From PNG to Russia to Sydney then back again: The return of the Rai Coast skulls

image.altText: chairman mao on a banknote

props.synopsis: Workers speak out about the impact of wage cuts in the finance sector in China, while simultaneous hikes to public sector pay packets leaves many people confused.

title.children: Workers stressed, confused as China cuts salaries in finance sector

image.altText: Hard Quiz host Tom Gleeson with his eyebrows raised and mouth open. The Hard Quiz logo is in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I must say, I do admire your courage in coming back this week for another try. Just kidding, I never feel that way.

title.children: Talk a big quiz game? It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: A digital illustraion of a man from nose down holding a hairdressing magazine with Vietnamese rice farmers in backgroud.

props.synopsis: The promise of work led Duong to Thailand, but he was soon enslaved in a remote corner of war-torn Myanmar, forced to carry out online cryptocurrency "pig-butchering" scams. It is part of a growing global problem affecting thousands of Australians every year.

title.children: Duong dreamed of being a hairdresser. Instead he was caught in a nightmare

image.altText: A close-up of a Buddhist stone statue with closed eyes and a neutral, peaceful expression on its face.

props.synopsis: Statues and hundreds of culturally significant artefacts have been returned to Indonesia by the Dutch, but with close to 30 museum theft cases in recent decades authorities move to ensure these don't end up in an illegal private collection.

title.children: Indonesia got some treasures back, but can it protect them?

image.altText: A wombat walks out of a burrow

props.synopsis: Conservationists say the lessons learnt from the northern hairy-nosed wombat could help save other animals around the globe.

title.children: Key to survival for one of the world's rarest creatures
